metadata.titleEn: Global average annual snow cover proportion data (2000-2021)
metadata.description: The fractional snow cover (FSC) is the ratio of snow cover area (SCA) to unit pixel area. The data set is made by bv-blrm snow area proportional linear regression empirical model; The source data used are mod09ga 500m global daily surface reflectance products and mod09a1 500m 8-day synthetic global surface reflectance products; The production platform uses Google Earth engine; The data range is global, the data preparation time is from 2000 to 2021, the spatial resolution is 500 meters, and the temporal resolution is year by year. This set of data can provide quantitative information of snow cover distribution for regional climate simulation and hydrological models.
metadata.instructions:
This dataset contains 352 tif files stored year by year from 2000 to 2021.
Element Item: BV_ BLRM_ mean_ FSC_ yyyy_ aa-bb-nnnnnnnnnn-oooooooooo.tif；
Field code description: BV_ BLRM stands for BV_ BLRM model; mean_ FSC stands for the proportion of annual snow cover area; Yyyy is the year, for example, 2010; Aa and bb represent the starting and ending range of latitude respectively; Nnnnnnnnnnnn-oooooooooo is a block marker within the latitude range of aa bb. In this series of data, each latitude zone is divided into four parts.
Usage: This data set can be read and operated in Arcgis, ENVI and other GIS and remote sensing software environments. Splicing and projection conversion are required before use.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics and specifications of data collection methods used for determining global fractional snow cover from 2000 to 2021?
Feature Specification.Answer: linear regression empirical model, BV-BLRM, MOD09GA 500-meter global daily surface reflectance product, MOD09A1 500-meter 8-day composite global surface reflectance product, Google Earth Engine platform, 500 meters spatial resolution, annual temporal resolution, 2000 to 2021

Quantification.Question: What is the spatial resolution used in the data collection method for the global annual fractional snow cover dataset between 2000 and 2021?

Definition.Question: What is the BV-BLRM snow cover area linear regression empirical model in the context of fractional snow cover data collection?
Definition.Answer: The BV-BLRM snow cover area linear regression empirical model is a method used to create datasets of fractional snow cover, which is the ratio of snow-covered area to the total pixel area. This model is employed to derive the fractional snow cover data using source data from MOD09GA 500-meter global daily surface reflectance products and MOD09A1 500-meter 8-day composite global surface reflectance products.

Interpretation.Question: What can be inferred about the global spatial distribution and temporal changes in snow cover from analyzing the fractional snow cover data collected using the BV-BLRM model and MOD09GA/MOD09A1 products from 2000 to 2021?
Interpretation.Answer: By analyzing the fractional snow cover data, researchers can infer patterns of snow cover changes over time and across different regions. The use of the BV-BLRM model and MOD09GA/MOD09A1 products allows for detailed examination of how snow cover has fluctuated annually between 2000 and 2021 on a global scale. This can help identify trends related to climate change, such as warming temperatures leading to reduced snow cover, and improve understanding of seasonal snow dynamics, regional climate impacts, and potential implications for water resources and ecosystems.

Goal Orientation.Question: What are the primary objectives behind creating a dataset that measures the fractional snow cover globally from 2000 to 2021?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary objectives of creating a dataset measuring the fractional snow cover globally from 2000 to 2021 include providing quantitative information on snow distribution for applications in regional climate modeling and hydrological models. This data can help understand snow cover dynamics and their impact on climate and water resources.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: How can the BV-BLRM linear regression empirical model be utilized to accurately compute fractional snow cover using MOD09GA and MOD09A1 datasets on the Google Earth Engine platform?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The BV-BLRM linear regression empirical model is employed to calculate the fractional snow cover by utilizing MOD09GA 500-meter global daily surface reflectance products and MOD09A1 500-meter 8-day composite global surface reflectance products. This process is executed on the Google Earth Engine platform, covering a global range with a spatial resolution of 500 meters and annual temporal resolution from 2000 to 2021.

Enablement.Question: What technological advancements have enabled the global collection and processing of fractional snow cover data with high spatial and temporal resolution?
Enablement.Answer: The use of Google Earth Engine as a data processing platform and the availability of MOD09GA and MOD09A1 global surface reflectance products have enabled the global collection and processing of fractional snow cover data with a spatial resolution of 500 meters and an annual temporal resolution, covering the period from 2000 to 2021.
